newsitem.title: UK: Reunion to proceed with prefeasibility at Skorpion.
newsitem.headline: Reunion to proceed with prefeasibility at Skorpion.

text.p: Reunion Mining plc is to proceed with a prefeasibility study at the Skorpion zinc deposit in Namibia, following positive results from initial metallurgical testwork.
Over the past four months studies have indicated that zinc may be recovered from the Skorpion ore by leaching with sulphuric acid.
The prefeasibility study, which is expected to be completed during the first quarter of 1997, is examining a mining operation to produce not less than 75,000 tonnes of zinc a year.
By producing on site and avoiding the production of concentrate and subsequent shipping and refining costs operating costs should be well within the lowest quartile for the industry.
Reunion has a right to earn up to a 60 percent interest in Skorpion from Erongo Mining and Exploration, a group company of Anglo American Corp of South Africa.
Previous exploration identified an open pittable resource of 8.3 million tonnes at 10.9 percent zinc.
